page_content:
Xplore Fibre Network – List of
Preferred Plant Materials

Objective:
The objective of this guideline is to provide the list preferred and approved product for Xplore fibre
network build

Relationship to existing Xplore Wireline National Standards:
1. N/A

[IMAGE: Xplore logo featuring a stylized "X" and the word "Xplore" in a modern font. Xplore®]

page_content:
# 1 List of Preferred Plant Materials

You can also follow the link to the Preferred Plant Material and Specification sheets Plant Material
Note: Any alternates to this list shall be reviewed and approved by Xplore prior to incorporation into
project

## 1.1 Fibre Distribution Hubs (FDH):

144f, 288f, 432f – Both Pole and Pad mount including splitters. Example: 144 (5 x 1:32 splitters), 288 (9 x
1:32 splitters), 432 (14 x 1:32 splitters)
1. Channell
2. CommScope FDH 3000
3. Corning LS Series
4. Priority FDH
For a Pad mount FDH use the Channell FDH Vault and the Priority Vault for the respective FDHs

## 1.2 Inside Fibre Distribution Hub (iFDH)

1. Channell OIWT (Optimus Indoor Wall Terminal) 48 Fibre Count
2. Channell OIWT 72 Fibre Count Note: Channell 1:32 Splitters can be mounted inside these
terminals in the fibre splice compartment

## 1.3 Multi-Port Terminals (MPT)

MPT with stub cables:4, 6, 8, 12 ports – all with Opti-Tap Ports
1. Commscope HST (replacing MST which is phasing out)
2. Corning Evolv Pushlok Multi Port Terminal

## 1.4 In-Line Terminal with Splice Tray

1. Corning – SCA_9T with Opti-Tap Ports (max 12 ports – 6 on each end)
2. Channell Yellow Jacket

## 1.5 Splitters

### 1.5.1 Installed in FOSC (1:2 and 1:16,1:4 and 1:8, and 1:32)

1. Fiber Source
2. Prysmian

### 1.5.2 Splitters for FDH (1:32 Splitter)

1. Fiber X for Channell
2. Priority Electronics Ltd HD Splitter Module

## 1.6 Fiber Optic Splice Closures (FOSC)

1. Commscope Closures:

[IMAGE: Concise summary: Logo of Xplore, featuring the name in a modern font with a stylized 'X' emblem. Extracted text: Xplore® X]

metadata.source: /Users/jayseregon/Documents/Telecon Design/Standards Xplore/4.1 XNS List of Preferred Plant Materials.pdf
metadata.file_path: /Users/jayseregon/Documents/Telecon Design/Standards Xplore/4.1 XNS List of Preferred Plant Materials.pdf
metadata.title: Microsoft Word - 4.1 XNS_List of Preferred Plant Materials.docx
metadata.author: KathrinKr

page_content:
a. 450 series – BS, C, and D

b. 400 series – for Manholes and where re-entry into existing cabled ports is not required
2. Corning FDC with ECAM
3. Channell:
c. Green Hornet G4 - 4”x11” - 24 fibre splice tray and 8 ports for drops or flat MPT Tails.
Can be equipped with Bulk Heads
d. Green Hornet G5 – 5”x14”
4. PLP:
** Please note that the below PLP products are only recommended for specific projects in order to deplete the
existing stock. These closures are not flagged for re-order **
e. Small 6.5” x 17”
f.
Medium 9.5” x 19”
g. Large 9.5” x 28”
h. Coyote One Dome Closure for smaller applications

## 1.7 Hand Holes (Service Box/Vault/Grade Level Box-GLB)

(13” x 24” x 18” D, 17” x 30” x 24” D, 24” x 36” x 24” D, 30” x 48” x 24” D, no bottoms)
1. Channell Bulk HH
a. Channel XCI Logo Disk
2. Duralite (Oldcastle) HH

## 1.8 Pedestals (If the pedestal is value mounted, then an accessory is required)

1. Channell MAH1420
2. Channell MAH1212

## 1.9 Flower Pots

1. Channell GLB (9”x12” no bottom)
2. Duralite (10” x 10” no bottom)

## 1.10 Conduit: Duraline, Emtelle or IPEX

1. HDPE Single 18/14mm, 4-way 18/14mm, 7-way 18/14mm
2. HDPE SDR 11
a. 32mm
b. 50mm
c. 100mm
3. HDPE SDR 13.5

[IMAGE: Xplore logo featuring the name "Xplore" and a stylized letter "X". Xplore® X]

metadata.source: /Users/jayseregon/Documents/Telecon Design/Standards Xplore/4.1 XNS List of Preferred Plant Materials.pdf
metadata.file_path: /Users/jayseregon/Documents/Telecon Design/Standards Xplore/4.1 XNS List of Preferred Plant Materials.pdf
metadata.title: Microsoft Word - 4.1 XNS_List of Preferred Plant Materials.docx
metadata.author: KathrinKr

page_content:
a. 20mm
b. 32mm
c. 50mm
d. 100mm
4. Conduit Caps (Channell):
a. 19mm for 20mm HDPE
b. 31.75mm for 32mm HDPE
c. 50.8mm for 50mm HDPE
5. HDPE 90* Bends (24” and 36” radius)
a. 32mm
b. 50mm
6. HDPE Multi Duct 18/14mm
a. 1-way 18/14mm
b. 4-way 18/14mm
c. 7-way 18/14mm
7. Multi Duct 14/10mm (Duraline or Emtelle) used for Micro Cables and Drops
a. 1-way 14/10mm
b. 7-way 14/10mm
8. Caps and Couplers (Duraline)
a. Caps 14/10mm
b. Straight couplers 14/10mm
c. Caps 18/14mm
d. Straight coupler 18/14mm
Note: Duraline also has Transition couplers (Various sizes – ex: 12.7mm to 10mm, etc.)
Fibre Cables
1. OFS – current XCI Standard
a. Double Jacket Dielectric
b. Single Jacket Dielectric
c. Single Armour, Single Jacket
d. AccuRoll Dry Core Rollable Ribbon
2. Superior Essex
a. Single Armour, Single Jacket
3. Teldor
a. Single Jacket Dielectric (F6 Network)
4. Prysmian
a. Indoor/Outdoor LSZH, Single Jacket, Dielectric (Confederation Bridge)
5. Emtelle

[IMAGE: Concise summary: Logo of Xplore, featuring the word "Xplore" with a stylized "X" design. Extracted text: Xplore®]

metadata.author: KathrinKr

page_content:
a. Micro Fibre Cable
6. AFL
a. SpiderWeb Ribbon (SWR)
b. LE Series / LN Series (Rodent Resistant)
7. CommScope
a. D-LN Series
8. Corning
a. SMF-28e+

## 1.11 Drops

1 fibre Flat Dielectric – Various lengths – OptiTap connector on one end only
1. Corning
2. Corning Roc Drop for the Evolv MPT
a. Evolv Pushlok to Opti-tap adapter is required to connect Opti-tap port
3. Commscope
4. Fiber Source
Round Drop Cable for underground placement only
1. Corning
2. Commscope

## 1.12 Mechanical Connectors for Fibre Drops (In Field Installed)

1. AFL Field Installed Connector
2. Corning Opti-Snap Single Mode Field –Installable Connector
3. Corning SC-APC NPC+ Connector

## 1.13 Transition Cabinets and POI Cabinets

1. Multilink Enclosure - Outside
2. Multilink POI Enclosure – Outside
3. Multilink FEC 288 Transition Cabinet – Inside
4. Wirewerks 1RU chassis with Optical Splicing trays for up to 24 Fibres

## 1.14 Fibre Patch Panel

1. Wirewerks (144 Fibre panel - 1R mounting space)
a. 12F Cassettes need to be order separately
2. FiberSource
a. 12 Fibre Wall Mount, 6752 Splice/Patch, 1x12F SCA w/3m 6 0 SM pigtails
b. 24F Wall Mount, 6752, Splice/Patch, 2x12F SCA w/3m 2 0 SM pigtails

[IMAGE: Xplore logo featuring a modern design with the text "Xplore®" and an emblematic "X." Xplore®]

page_content:
3. Multilink 288F – 6.5R mounting space (use in F6 CO’s)
a. 12F Cassettes need to be order separately

## 1.15 Network Interface Device (NID)

1. Primex P350FSC-THG2SA 2 Fiber Enclosure (Wireline – SC/APC Connectors)
2. Primex P750FSC-THG6SA 6 Fibre Enclosure (Wireline – SC/APC Connectors)
3. Primex P1000MFSC-THG12SA-SD 12 Fibre Enclosure (Wireline – SC/APC Connectors)
4. Primex P1000MFSC-THG12LU-SD 12 Fiber Enclosure (Wireless – LC/UPC Connectors)
5. Primex P1000MFSC-THG24LU-SD 24 Fiber Enclosure (Wireless – LC/UPC Connectors)
Note: Most of these products are referenced in the Xplore National Standards – Fibre documents. Please
contact Xplore project Manager for latest revised copy.

[IMAGE: Xplore logo featuring the name "Xplore" in a modern font alongside a stylized letter "X". Xplore®]
